author: Laurence Norman
title: NATO Pushes EU to Work With Allies for Security
text:
MUNICH—Amid the biggest revamp of European defense in years, NATO is pushing the European Union to work closely with non-EU allies as the U.K. maneuvers to maintain its leverage in the region’s security after it exits the bloc.
The push came to a head at the Munich Security Conference over the weekend, where Jens Stoltenberg, secretary-general of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization Treaty, warned that after Britain’s exit, the EU alone wouldn’t be able to ensure European security.
